items.description: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels remain high, but are falling slowly, on the River Windrush following recent rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 1/11/24, especially in the Bourton on the Water and Newbridge areas. 

The forecast today is dry, and conditions should remain settled for the next few days. We expect river levels to continue falling, but levels remain sensitive to rainfall. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 2/11/24, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels remain high, but are falling slowly, on the Ginge Brook in Steventon. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, 1/11/24. The forecast today is dry, and conditions should remain settled for the rest of the week. We expect river levels to continue falling, but levels remain sensitive to rainfall. We are monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 2/11/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
The groundwater situation is improving and no further flooding is expected in this area.

Groundwater levels across the West of Dorset have now levelled off/started to recede. Some minor roads may still have flood water across them, however the risk to motorists and property is now reduced. The forecast is for a more settled spell of weather. Continue to take care on roads as road surfaces may have been damaged. Do not attempt to drive through floodwater, as bow waves may affect adjacent properties.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
